Island Module¶

This is the Island model which functions with the BioSim package written for the INF200 project January 2019.

class biosim.island.Island(island_map)[source]¶

Bases: object

Constructor for the Island class.

add_population(given_pop)[source]¶

This method creates the population objects inside the cells.

given_pop: list

create_cells()[source]¶

This method creates a dictionary with the coordinates on keys and landscape objects on values.

dict

fauna_classes = {'Carnivore': <class 'biosim.fauna.Carnivore'>, 'Herbivore': <class 'biosim.fauna.Herbivore'>}¶
geo_classes = {'D': <class 'biosim.geography.Desert'>, 'J': <class 'biosim.geography.Jungle'>, 'M': <class 'biosim.geography.Mountain'>, 'O': <class 'biosim.geography.Ocean'>, 'S': <class 'biosim.geography.Savannah'>}¶
get_population_numbers()[source]¶

This method checks the population number of each specie, by coordinates, store them and returns a dictionary with {‘Row’: [ ], ‘Col’: [], ‘Herbivore’: [], ‘Carnivore’: []}.

Dictionary with the population numbers.

property habitable_cells¶

This method creates a dictionary with only the coordinates that are habitable and store the coordinates on keys and landscape objects on values.

dict

habitable_geos = {'D': <class 'biosim.geography.Desert'>, 'J': <class 'biosim.geography.Jungle'>, 'S': <class 'biosim.geography.Savannah'>}¶
static list_geo_cells(island_map)[source]¶

This method makes a multiline-string accessible and compatible to the others method.

island_map: str

List of landscapes.

neighbour_cells(loc)[source]¶

This method localizes the neighbour cells (north, south, west and east), checks if they are habitable and returns a list with the landscape objects.

List with the habitable neighbours.

set_parameters(param_key, params)[source]¶

This method sets the parameter for the landscapes and animals.

param_key: str

params: list

yearly_cycle()[source]¶

This method calls, in order, the methods that compound the yearly cycle dynamics of the island, such that:

  1. Growing of fodder;

  2. Animal’s feeding;

  3. Animals’s birth;

  4. Animal’s migration;

  5. Animal’s aging;

  6. Animal’s weight loss;

  7. Animal’s death.
